wait, this creates a _visible_ private field whose name is derived from the name of the accessor? i thought decorator's auto-accessors created private fields which you couldn't actually refer to (even in the body of the class)

content.body: I don't think so. At least that wasn't my reading
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I don't think so. At least that wasn't my reading

content.body: the `#set` creates a private setter

> <@bakkot:matrix.org> wait, this creates a _visible_ private field whose name is derived from the name of the accessor? i thought decorator's auto-accessors created private fields which you couldn't actually refer to (even in the body of the class)

No. It's not visible, has a private field that you cannot access directly (must use the #set)
content.formatted_body:
In reply to bakkot
wait, this creates a visible private field whose name is derived from the name of the accessor? i thought decorator's auto-accessors created private fields which you couldn't actually refer to (even in the body of the class)
No. It's not visible, has a private field that you cannot access directly (must use the #set)

content.body: I think it's like if you do `accessor x { get; #set }` then you have a paired getter `this.x` and setter `this.#x`
content.formatted_body: I think it's like if you do accessor x { get; #set } then you have a paired getter this.x and setter this.#x
